message: Need to use convore more often btw
Morning, and from what I know, no. But I guess if there are vulnerabilities they could always get access to your db.
The messages are a little...large though to use it like a normal chat
And yes, convore is pretty nifty. I just started playing with the android client called "Convorsation Beta". It's cool, I guess.

The way I see it, disqus provides near-perfect separation of concerns -- comments don't touch my db, so I have a lot fewer user accounts to manage, and consequently less attack surface. If the disqus servers are somehow compromised, I still have only lost control of comments. If that happens, I can disable the disqus injection code, and my blog is still clean. It's classic defense in depth.
If @biosshadow has a different opinion, I'd really love to hear it. :-)
I've had other people put my comments feed on their blogs before, which is irritating.  But they've implemented some fixes to stop that now.
